description: Late Iron Age to Roman Farmstead. The site of an Iron age coin hoard discovered by metal detecting and then limited archaeological investigations, the location has been suggested as a 'Late Iron Age hill-top religious space' due to the deposit.
bibliography: Hurst. “The South Worcestershire Hoards Archaeological Survey at Allesborough, Pershore, Worcestershire,” 2000. https://doi.org/10.5284/1026871.
Hurst, and Leins. “The Pershore Hoards and Votive Deposition in the Iron Age.” Proceedings of the Prehistoric Society 79 (2013).
———. “The Pershore Iron Age Coin Hoards.” Transactions of the Worcestershire Archaeological Society 24 (2014).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Allesborough, Pershore (Worcestershire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
